title: 'No chance' Neil Woodford will return fees despite fund failures
text:
Neil Woodford has no intention of reimbursing investors for the fees they have been charge, despite renewed pressure to do so, Telegraph Money understands.

Now his flagship Equity Income fund has completely failed, calls for the manager to return fees to investors have intensified.

However, he is understood to have dismissed these calls, nonchalantly suggesting there was no reason to do so. A person familiar with the matter said: "Neil is not going to give money back to investors. Why should he? He has been paid to do a job, whether you think it's a good or bad job does not matter."

This newspaper, broker Hargreaves Lansdown, regulator the Financial Conduct Authority and MPs all lobbied for...
description: Neil Woodford has no intention of reimbursing investors for the fees they have been charge, despite renewed pressure to do so, Telegraph Money understands.
